abstract: In another sign of Russia’s souring relationship with Western oil companies, foreign staff members of BP‘s joint venture in Russia, including the chief executive, will be required to leave the country later this month, some of them permanently, because their work permits were not renewed, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: In another sign of Russia’s souring relationship with Western oil companies, foreign staff members of BP‘s joint venture in Russia, including the chief executive, will be required to leave the country later this month, some of them permanently, because their work permits were not renewed, The New York Times reported.

headline.main: BP Chief and Staff Face Removal From Russia
